Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Sheets and Extractor
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=5Y7nZNWoOJ2q5zdqSmi8vFZD2FD_WGM_NztrKWB6aXY8

On 5/1/12 5:28 AM, Coram, Roger wrote:
>
>
> Is it possible to disable extractors from a Sheet association? Could,
> for instance, extractorJs be disabled entirely but only for certain SURTs?

Yes! Every Processor has an 'enabled' property, default true. If instead 
set to false, the Processor does nothing.

So, you could create a Sheet which targets 'extractorJs.enabled' with 
the overlay value 'false'. Then, associate that sheet with the desired 
SURT-prefixes.

One note: much JS extraction occurs within ExtratorHTML, so a 
comprehensive 'skipJsExtraction' sheet might also want to set the 
property at path 'extractorHtml.extractJavascript' to false.

- Gordon

> Thanks.
